fulltext:
Martin Doan 
A strategic thinker and a problem solver with hands-on 
experiences in leading strategic projects with cross-functional 
and long-term impact globally 
martin.tdoan@gmail.com 
+65-9128-5235 
Singapore 
WORK EXPERIENCE 
Feb 2018 – Present 
Manager – Digital Business Strategy & Planning  
Daimler Financial Services, Africa & Asia Pacific –Singapore 
 Lead a cross-functional team on a market entry feasibility study with the focus on setting up a 
fully digital business model for car financing and leasing in South East Asia region 
 Responsible for developing business case and budget planning of strategic projects 
 Consult C-suite management team on key business steering topics such as business roadmap 
& capacity planning by aligning with stakeholders on all levels 
 Spearhead the development of team and product performance indicators to support 
management decisions 
 Act as executive assistant to head of department on daily business activities 
Jan 2016 – Jan 2018      Manager – Product Owner, Digital Reporting & Analytics  
Daimler Financial Services, Africa & Asia Pacific – Daimler South East Asia, Singapore 
 Acted as the Product Owner of Digital Reporting Suite with hands-on experiences in Agile 
software development, specialised in management reporting and analytics  
 Co-lead a scrum team of cross-functional members and external vendors located in Singapore, 
Germany and Croatia, successfully rolled out to all markets globally under tight deadlines with 
positive feedback from users 
 Engaged end-users from early stage and throughout the product development cycle by 
conducting Design Thinking Workshop and interviews to define UX/ UI of future products 
 Recruited and coach junior members of the team, keep the entrepreneurial spirit high and at 
the same time, having fun 
 Winner of “Game Changer Award 2016” for digitalising internal global reporting processes 
 Winner of “CFO Innovation Award 2017” for excellence in analytics transformation 
Jan 2015 – Jan 2016 
Assistant Manager – Regional Financial Controller 
Daimler Financial Services, Africa & Asia Pacific – Daimler South East Asia, Singapore 
 Developed multivariable financial models using internal and external data to derive insights on 
business developments to support decision making of regional management team 
 Chaired monthly business update meetings to monitor performance of Japan, Thailand and 
Malaysia, targets of all markets under responsibility were overachieved 
 Reduced team workload by 40% by creating automatic procedures to replace repeated tasks 
Nov 2013 – Jan 2015 
Management Trainee, The Top Talents Program 
Daimler Financial Services, Africa & Asia Pacific – Daimler South East Asia, Singapore 
 Engaged in cross-functional projects with Sales, Credit and Risk Management 
 Experienced various management styles and working environments through assignments in 
Stuttgart, Tokyo, Beijing and Singapore 
EDUCATION 
Sep 2018 – Mar 2019 Executive Education – Strategic Digital Marketing 
Cambridge Judge Business School 
May 2018 – Jul 2018 
Executive Education – Artificial Intelligence: Implications for Business Strategy 
MIT SLOAN & MIT CSAIL     
Sep 2017 – Oct 2017 
Executive Education – Strategy in the Age of Digital Disruption 
INSEAD 
Jan 2015 - Jun 2015 
CFA Level I Passed 
Chartered Financial Analysis 
Sep 2011 – Sep 2012 MSc in Finance (Investment Management) – graduated with Distinction (~top 10%) 
Cass Business School, City University of London – London, United Kingdom 
Sep 2008 – Jul 2011 
BSc in Mathematics with Management and Finance – Upper Second Class Honours 
King’s College London – London, United Kingdom     
OTHER RESPONSIBILITY 
Nov 2016 – Present 
Team Manager & Captain 
Daimler Roosters Football Club - Singapore 
 Founded the first football team in company history 
 Negotiated and obtained sponsorship for league fees and jerseys 
 Recruited and led 20 team members to compete weekly in ESPZEN league, a well-established 
football league in Singapore 
Jan 2015 – Jan 2016 
Diversity Ambassador  
Daimler Financial Services, Africa & Asia Pacific – Daimler South East Asia, Singapore 
 Ensured information about diversity such as differences in gender, race, ethic group, age and 
culture in workplace is well communicated to all colleagues 
 Raised awareness of key diversity topics by coordinating a “Diversity Day” and received 
positive feedback from 100+ participants 
 Represented regional office in annual “Global Diversity Conference”  
PROFESSIONAL SKILLS 
IT Skills 
 Advanced skills in data management and visualisation SQL, Power BI, IBM Cognos TM1 
 Highly proficient in Excel, PowerPoint and other Microsoft Office Suite 
Languages 
 Vietnamese (native) 
 English (full professional proficiency) 
Other Interests 
 Football, tennis and golf 
 Currently learning to code to develop applications for good causes
